title: Alternatives to Zapf Elliptical
content:
Hi  
I’m looking for a more “contemporary” alternative to Zapf Elliptical  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/zapf-elliptical-711/bt-zapf-ellipt...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/zapf-elliptical-711/bt-zapf-elliptical-711/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/zapf-elliptical-711/bt-zapf-elliptical-711/")

Anyone?

thanks,

alex

author: alexfjelldal

comments.content:
First, this is essentially [Melior](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/melior/?refby=typographica).

There aren’t a lot of alternatives to Melior (other than Zapf’s other [even more dated designs](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/marconi_virtual/)), which is surprising considering the recent popularity of square sans serifs. Type makers, get on it!

[RePublic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/suitcase/republic/?refby=typographica) is really the only thing I can recall that comes close.

It’s a bit of a stretch, but I really love [FF Danubia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_danubia/) as a contemporary take on vertically stressed serifs of all kinds.
Maybe [Charter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/itc_charter_ot/), which isn’t so new, but still manages to appear very fresh.

[Jelle Bosma](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Jelle%252BBosma)’s [Forlane](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Forlane) has similar forms, but a much smaller x-height and fancier italics.

Not necessarily more contemporary, but [Kepler](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1431.html) and [Utopia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1415.html) sure are alternatives.

I recommend [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller "Font Bureau Fonts | Miller") from Font Bureau. It’s not as square as your example, but it’s nice and wide.

FB’s [Proforma](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/serif/Proforma "Font Bureau Fonts | Proforma") may also fit the bill.

I knew there was a similar thread just a short while back...

[http://typophile.com/node/34628](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202195903/http:/typophile.com/node/34628 "http://typophile.com/node/34628")
